Portland Barcamp 2012

March 31, 2012 . . Comments
Tags: blog_post

Made the journey up to Portland for my first Barcamp. Joined by a couple of buddies from the KMUZ, we arrived to witness the scheduling process. I decided to just observe this time, but Nate pitched a session. It was a very interesting process.

First Session

My first session of the morning was lead by a contributor to the linux kernel. Lot's deep CS discussion.

Second Session

Next, I participated in a discussion on bug data and some of the issues created from user input.

Lunch

We grabbed lunch at a great middle-eastern deli called All Spice Deli.

Third Session

This session focused on testing/UX testing. Learned a lot about boundary testing, Equivalence partitioning and other testing procdures

  • http://code.google.com/p/fighting-layout-bugs/
  • https://github.com/GaloisInc/FiveUI

Comments Section

Feel free to comment on the post but keep it clean and on topic.
